page.title: 11STRAIGHT POINT RIFLE RANGE
page.content: My Dad is a corporal in the Royal Marines. He has told me about Straight Point Rifle Range which is on the cliffs over looking Sandy Bay. My Dad has practised shooting in the ranges quite a few times. It's used by recruits in training. Often they are in small groups. When we went to Sandy Bay we saw several men lying on the ground and two men standing up instructing them.The ranges are surrounded by a big fence.There are several ranges from 30 metres to 600 metres where they test different types of guns.My dad's favourite gun is the Uzi.Once two men were shot because they were messing around with the guns.Holiday makers from the Devon Cliffs Holiday Park have complained about the noise of the guns.The ranges are on the cliffs because stray bullets will go into the sea.
